meta.name: Track Technology Changes with BuiltWith and Log to Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## üß© SECTION 1: **üîò Manual Start + üìù Set Target Technology**

### üéØ Purpose:

This section allows **you (the user)** to manually start the workflow and specify **which technology** (e.g., Shopify, WordPress, React) you're interested in searching for via BuiltWith.

### üîπ Nodes:

* **üîò Manual Trigger** (`Manual Trigger`)
  ‚û§ This lets you run the workflow manually while testing or for one-time actions.
  üìç Tip: Great for workflows that don't need to run on a schedule.

* **üìù Set Technology** (`Set` Node)
  ‚û§ You manually define the **technology name** here (e.g., "Shopify").
  ‚û§ You can add a field like:

  ```json
  {
    "technologies": "Shopify"
  }
  ```

  ‚úÖ This makes the workflow dynamic ‚Äî you can change the tech each time without editing multiple nodes.

### üî∞ What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **Manual Trigger** to run a test or ad-hoc job.
* How to use the **Set Node** to insert static/custom data into the flow.
* How workflows can be made flexible with variables like `technologies`.

---

## üîó SECTION 2: **üåê Fetch + üß† Process BuiltWith Data**

### üéØ Purpose:

Use the HTTP Request node to connect with the BuiltWith API, and then process the JSON response to extract useful data about the websites.

### üîπ Nodes:

* **üåê Fetch BuiltWith Data** (`HTTP Request`)
  ‚û§ Sends a `GET` request to BuiltWith‚Äôs API to find websites using the selected technology.
  ‚û§ Example URL:

  ```
  https://api.builtwith.com/v20/api.json?KEY=YOUR_API_KEY&TECH=Shopify&START=0
  ```

  üîë Make sure to replace `YOUR_API_KEY` with your real BuiltWith API key.

* **üß† Extract Site Info** (`Function` Node)
  ‚û§ This node parses the JSON response from BuiltWith and pulls out the key fields:

  * `domain`
  * `technology`
  * `firstIndexed`
  * `vertical`
    ‚û§ Example output (ready for sheets):

  ```json
  {
    "domain": "www.example-shop.com",
    "technology": "Shopify",
    "firstIndexed": "2024-11-02",
    "vertical": "E-commerce"
  }
  ```

### üî∞ What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **HTTP Request** node to work with any public API.
* How to read API documentation (BuiltWith) and form queries.
* How to process complex API responses using a **Function Node** to extract and clean data.

---

## üìä SECTION 3: **üìÑ Log to Google Sheets**

### üéØ Purpose:

Store the clean data into a Google Sheet so that it can be used for:

* Lead generation
* Email campaigns
* Technology tracking
* Competitor research

### üîπ Node:

* **üìÑ Log to Google Sheet** (`Google Sheets ‚Üí Append`)
  ‚û§ Appends the parsed data from the previous step to your spreadsheet.
  ‚û§ Each row represents a different website using the technology.
  ‚û§ Example columns:

  * A: Domain
  * B: Technology
  * C: First Indexed
  * D: Vertical

üîê You‚Äôll authenticate this once using Google OAuth2 ‚Äî n8n saves the connection for future runs.

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# ‚ú® **n8n Workflow: Monitor Tech Stack with BuiltWith & Send Email Alerts**

---

## üî∂ **SECTION 1: Trigger & Input Setup**

üß© *Nodes Involved:*
1Ô∏è‚É£ `Trigger: Manual Run`
2Ô∏è‚É£ `Set: BuiltWith Parameters`

---

### üéØ **What Happens Here?**

This section **starts the workflow** and **sets up the inputs** needed to make the BuiltWith API request.

#### üñ±Ô∏è 1. `Trigger: Manual Run`

* ‚öôÔ∏è *Type:* Manual Trigger
* üîç *Purpose:* Allows you to **test the workflow manually** by clicking ‚ÄúExecute Workflow‚Äù inside n8n.
* ‚úÖ Useful for debugging or running ad hoc checks.

#### üìù 2. `Set: BuiltWith Parameters`

* üß™ *Type:* Set Node (manual input field editor)
* üì§ *Purpose:* Adds key input fields such as:

  * `API Key`: Your BuiltWith API Key üîê
  * `TECH`: The technology you want to track (e.g., `Webflow`, `Shopify`, etc.) üß±

> üí° **Beginner Tip:** You can reuse this node to switch techs any time. Just change the `TECH` value to track other platforms like `Shopify`, `Wix`, etc.

---

## üî∑ **SECTION 2: Fetch & Format Website Data**

üß© *Nodes Involved:*
3Ô∏è‚É£ `Fetch Tech Domains (BuiltWith API)`
4Ô∏è‚É£ `Format BuiltWith Response`

---

### üß† **What Happens Here?**

This section talks to the **BuiltWith API**, gets the data, and formats it so it's readable and usable.

#### üåê 3. `Fetch Tech Domains (BuiltWith API)`

* üîó *Type:* HTTP Request Node
* üì° *Purpose:* Makes a `GET` request to the [BuiltWith API](https://builtwith.com/), asking:

  > ‚ÄúHey! Show me websites using this specific tech.‚Äù
* üßæ It returns a list of domains using the tech you entered in the previous step, including:

  * Domain name üåê
  * First detected date üìÖ
  * Other technologies found üß©

#### üõ†Ô∏è 4. `Format BuiltWith Response`

* üßÆ *Type:* Code Node (JavaScript)
* üß† *Purpose:* Extracts and formats the response into clean, readable values:

  * `Domain`: `example1.com`
  * `Technologies`: `Webflow, Stripe, Google Analytics`
  * `First Detected Dates`: `2025-06-04, N/A, 2025-06-05`

> üí° **Beginner Tip:** This code transforms messy JSON into something clear, which you can now send in an email, Slack, or save in Airtable.

---

## üü• **SECTION 3: Send Email Alert**

üß© *Node Involved:*
5Ô∏è‚É£ `Send Alert Email (Gmail)`

---

### üì¨ **What Happens Here?**

This final section takes the formatted data and **sends it to your inbox** using Gmail.

#### üì§ 5. `Send Alert Email (Gmail)`

* ‚úâÔ∏è *Type:* Gmail Node
* üîî *Purpose:* Sends you an email for each domain found using the tech.
* üîç Includes:

  * Domain name
  * All technologies used
  * Detection dates
* üßë‚Äçüíº Perfect for sending leads to your **sales**, **BD**, or **marketing team**.

> üí° **Beginner Tip:** You can change the "To" address to send alerts to team members, or use conditional logic to notify only when specific techs are found.

---

## üåü **Summary: Why This Workflow is Powerful**

| Benefit üí°                  | Description                                                                |
| --------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| üîç Discover Leads           | Automatically find websites using tools your business supports or sells to |
| üìß Instant Alerts           | Get notified via Gmail when new websites appear                            |
| üß© Highly Customizable      | Change tech stack (e.g. `Webflow`, `Shopify`, `WordPress`) in seconds      |
| üö´ No-Code-Friendly         | Easy to maintain even if you're not a developer                            |
| üèóÔ∏è Reusable Building Block | Can be extended to Slack, Airtable, or CRM integrations                    |

---

Technologies.Name: Shopify
Technologies.Description: Shopify is a hosted ecommerce platform.
